items.title: Google Search’s new ‘AI Mode’ lets users ask complex, multi-part questions
items.author: Aisha Malik
items.summary:
- Google is launching an experimental feature called 'AI Mode' in Search to allow multi-part questions.
- The feature rolls out to Google One AI Premium subscribers via [Search Labs](https://labs.google.com/search/).
- AI Mode uses [Gemini 2.0](https://techcrunch.com/2024/12/11/gemini-2-0-googles-newest-flagship-ai-can-generate-text-images-and-speech/) for advanced reasoning and comparative searches, enabling detailed comparisons of products and topics.
- Users can ask follow-up questions, enhancing search depth and user engagement.
- Google states that users are asking longer and more complex queries in testing.
- AI Mode employs a 'query fan-out' technique for concurrent searches across data sources to produce consolidated responses.
- The model prioritizes factual accuracy, especially in sensitive topics like health, and may provide links when uncertain.
- Google plans to refine the user experience and incorporate diverse content sources over time.

items.title: Anna Patterson’s Ceramic.ai looks to help enterprises build AI models faster and more efficiently
items.author: Becca Szkutak
items.summary:
- Anna Patterson, founder of Ceramic.ai, previously worked at Google and started multiple startups.
- After a breast cancer diagnosis, she founded Ceramic.ai in January 2024 to simplify AI model training for enterprises.
- Ceramic.ai aims to improve efficiency in training large language models, and has signed partnerships with AWS and Lambda without generating revenue yet.
- The startup raised a $12 million seed round led by NEA, with investments from IBM, Samsung Next, and Earthshot Ventures.
- Patterson's experience as a VC has influenced her approach, emphasizing quicker customer feedback and product iteration.

items.title: Hyundai pairs up with Yandex spinoff Avride to develop robotaxis
items.author: Kirsten Korosec
items.summary:
- Hyundai Motor Company and Avride will jointly develop autonomous vehicles for robotaxi services.
- The partnership includes expanding Avride's fleet of Hyundai Ioniq 5 vehicles, which will feature Avride's autonomous technology.
- Robotaxis are expected to launch later this year in Dallas and will be accessed through the Uber app.
- The collaboration aims to explore additional applications such as autonomous delivery services.
- Hyundai is also backing Motional, another autonomous vehicle venture, which has faced challenges but continues to pursue Level 4 autonomy.

items.title: Justice Department charges Chinese hackers-for-hire linked to Treasury breach
items.author: Carly Page
items.summary:
- The Department of Justice has charged 12 Chinese hackers linked to over 100 U.S. organizations hacked in a decade, including the U.S. Treasury.
- The hackers include contract hackers and law enforcement officials targeting free speech and religious freedoms.
- Two indicted individuals, Yin Kecheng and Zhou Shuai, are associated with the APT27 hacking group and exploited security flaws in major enterprise software.
- The hackers targeted various U.S. organizations, including tech firms and government entities, and stole data for profit.
- Rewards of up to $10 million and $2 million are offered for information leading to I-Soon employees and the arrest of Yin and Zhou respectively.

items.title: Anthropic quietly removes Biden-era AI policy commitments from its website
items.author: Kyle Wiggers
items.summary:
- Anthropic has removed voluntary AI safety commitments made with the Biden Administration in 2023 from its website.
- The deleted commitments included sharing information on AI risk management and research on AI bias.
- The removals were noted by AI watchdog group The Midas Project, and other commitments related to AI-generated abuse remain.
- The Biden Administration aimed to signal AI policy priorities ahead of an AI Executive Order issued months later.
- Trump's administration is taking a different approach, having repealed the AI Executive Order and promoting AI development free from ideological bias.

items.title: Flex, a Brex for business owners, has raised $25M at a $250M valuation
items.author: Mary Ann Azevedo
items.summary:
- Flex raised $25 million in equity funding and secured a $200 million credit facility.
- The company, founded in 2022 by CEO Zaid Rahman, focuses on personal finance software for mid-market business owners.
- Flex has grown to $1 billion in annualized total payment volume within 18 months and is currently growing 25% month over month.
- Notable features include AI underwriting and invoice processing, along with a credit card offering 0% interest for 60 days on all purchases.
- The latest funding round was led by Titanium Ventures, with additional participation from various investment firms.

items.title: Growth at all costs is destroying the internet. PR maven Ed Zitron says that’s an opportunity for startups
items.author: Ed Zitron
items.summary:
- Ed Zitron critiques the internet's deteriorating user experience due to the dominance of ads and subscription models.
- He describes this situation as the "rot economy," emphasizing that customers have become secondary in big tech's push for growth.
- Zitron identifies various sectors ripe for disruption, including social media, enterprise software, and email, encouraging startups to challenge failing incumbents.
- Platforms like Bluesky and Mastodon are emerging as alternatives to established social networks like Instagram and X.
- Zitron argues that the stagnation of major companies offers a crucial opportunity for new startups to provide better user experiences and products.

items.title: EU must ‘fully’ apply its market fairness rulebook on Google, search rivals urge
items.summary:
- The EU is urged to expand its investigation of Google under the Digital Markets Act (DMA) to ensure compliance.
- Alternative search engines DuckDuckGo and Seznam.cz are accusing Google of violating the DMA rules.
- An open letter was sent to EU Commission EVPs urging full application of DMA on Google, addressing concerns over Google's choice screen implementation and data sharing related to search queries.
- The letter arrives as the EU faces pressure from the U.S. regarding fairness in regulations, highlighting the complex dynamics of international tech regulations.

items.title: AI pioneers scoop Turing Award for reinforcement learning work
items.author: Paul Sawers
items.summary:
- Andrew G. Barto and Richard S. Sutton won the 2024 [Turing Award](https://amturing.acm.org/) for their work in reinforcement learning.
- Their research includes significant algorithms and theories dating back to the 1980s, including [temporal difference learning](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Temporal_difference_learning).
- The Turing Award, often called the 'Nobel Prize for computing', emphasizes the importance and ongoing relevance of their contributions to AI and machine learning.
- Barto and Sutton will share a $1 million cash prize, supported by Google.

items.title: YouTube launches a $7.99 per month, ad-free Premium Lite subscription
items.author: Sarah Perez
items.summary:
- YouTube introduced a new subscription tier named **Premium Lite** for **$7.99 per month**, allowing users to watch most videos ad-free.
- This subscription does not include benefits like downloads, background play, or ad-free music video viewing, unlike the full YouTube Premium at **$13.99 per month**.
- The Lite tier has been piloted in **Thailand, Germany, and Australia**, and is now available in the U.S., with plans to expand to more markets soon.
- The subscription aims to attract younger viewers and increase YouTube's revenue from subscriptions, potentially supporting creators' businesses.
- YouTube reports that most viewing in the U.S. is now occurring on televisions, surpassing mobile and desktop viewing.

items.title: Google’s Shopping tab has a new AI tool that takes your fashion idea and suggests similar clothing
items.author: Lauren Forristal
items.summary:
- Google launched a new AI feature called "Vision Match" for its Shopping tab, enabling users to search for clothing by describing what they envision.
- The feature is available for U.S. mobile users and provides suggestions based on user descriptions along with purchasable matches.
- Google is also enhancing its AR beauty tools, allowing users to virtually try on multiple makeup products and expanding its virtual try-on experience for clothing with various sizes and models.

items.title: Apply to speak at TechCrunch Sessions: AI before time runs out
items.summary:
- TechCrunch Sessions: AI is seeking speakers to shape the future of AI on June 5, 2025, at UC Berkeley.
- Up to four speakers can lead a dynamic 50-minute session that includes a presentation and Q&A.
- The deadline to apply to speak is March 7, 2025, at 11:59 p.m. PT.

items.title: Broadcom urges VMware customers to patch ‘emergency’ zero-day bugs under active exploitation
items.author: Carly Page
items.summary:
- Broadcom warns of three actively exploited VMware vulnerabilities affecting ESXi, Workstation, and Fusion hypervisors.
- The vulnerabilities, labeled “ESXicape,” allow attackers to escape virtual machines to gain access to the hypervisor.
- Broadcom has released patches and categorized these vulnerabilities as “zero-day” bugs, urging immediate application by customers.
- U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) has also warned federal agencies to patch against these vulnerabilities.

items.title: Apple updates the Mac Studio with M4 Max and M3 Ultra options
items.author: Romain Dillet
items.summary:
- Apple launched a new Mac Studio with M4 Max and M3 Ultra options, starting at $1,999.
- Pre-orders begin today, with availability in the Apple Store on March 12.
- The M3 Ultra features a 32-core CPU, up to 80 graphics cores, and boasts up to 2x better performance than M2 Ultra.
- The M4 Max has a 14-core CPU and a 32-core GPU.
- Custom configurations allow up to 512GB of RAM and 16TB of storage.
- The design remains similar, featuring multiple ports including Thunderbolt 5 and traditional USB-A ports.
- An M3 Ultra can support up to eight 6K displays or four 8K displays.

items.title: Apple launches new MacBook Air with M4 chip
items.author: Romain Dillet
items.summary:
- Apple has introduced a new MacBook Air featuring the M4 chip, offering improved performance.
- Available in 13-inch and 15-inch models, starting at $999.
- Maintains 16GB of RAM in the base configuration and features upgraded Thunderbolt ports to Thunderbolt 4.
- Lighter and more affordable than the MacBook Pro, but with trade-offs like shorter battery life and display quality.
- The M4 chip was first introduced with the iPad Pro in May 2024 and has since been phased into various Apple products.

items.title: GibberLink lets AI agents call each other in robo-language
items.author: Boris Starkov, Anton Pidkuiko, Maxwell Zeff
items.summary:
- GibberLink allows AI agents to communicate over the phone using a robotic language incomprehensible to humans.
- The project was created by Meta engineers during a hackathon in London and uses the GGWave protocol for efficient AI-to-AI communication.
- The demonstration has gone viral, attracting over 15 million views and sparking discussions about the future of AI communication.

items.title: CIA director says US has paused sharing intelligence with Ukraine
items.author: Zack Whittaker
items.summary:
- CIA director John Ratcliffe confirmed the pause in U.S. intelligence sharing with Ukraine following a disagreement between leaders.
- President Trump requested a “pause” after questioning Ukrainian President Zelenskyy’s commitment to the peace process.
- The pause could affect Ukraine's ability to defend against Russian attacks, though Ratcliffe believes it will be temporary.

items.title: Experts Don’t Think AI Is Ready to Be a ‘Co-Scientist’
items.summary:
- Google announced an AI co-scientist to aid in scientific research but experts believe it lacks practicality and empirical support.
- Researchers like Sarah Beery from MIT and Favia Dubyk from Arizona criticize the AI co-scientist for being vague and not trustworthy.
- The scientific community highlights AI's limitations in replicating human intuition and the hands-on nature of scientific research.
- Experts caution that AI could flood academic literature with low-quality research unless proper monitoring is enforced.

items.title: U.K.’s competition authority says Microsoft’s OpenAI partnership doesn’t qualify for investigation
items.author: Kyle Wiggers
items.summary:
- The U.K.'s Competition and Markets Authority (CMA) stated that Microsoft’s partnership with OpenAI doesn't qualify for investigation under the Enterprise Act 2002.
- The CMA concluded there is no change of control over OpenAI's commercial policy, only a material influence by Microsoft.
- The investigation into the partnership began in December 2023 due to concerns that Microsoft might restrict rivals' access to OpenAI's models.
- Recent developments indicated a reduction in Microsoft’s control over OpenAI.
- Microsoft has renegotiated its cloud computing agreement with OpenAI, allowing more independent operational space for OpenAI.

items.title: Grain emerges from stealth with $50M to help any business hedge against FX volatility
items.author: Ingrid Lunden
items.summary:
- Startup Grain raises over $50 million to help businesses hedge against foreign exchange (FX) volatility.
- The company processes over $1 billion in transactions, aiming to cater to companies of all sizes.
- Funding includes a $33 million Series A led by Bain Capital Ventures and an $18 million seed round, with notable backers.

items.title: Kevin Rose and Alexis Ohanian Acquire Digg
items.author: null
items.summary:
- Kevin Rose, original founder of [Digg](https://digg.com/), and Reddit co-founder [Alexis Ohanian](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alexis_Ohanian) have acquired the platform.
- Digg and Reddit were competitors, launched nearly two decades ago, with Reddit's growth eventually outpacing Digg's.
- Digg was split and sold off in parts in 2012, later acquired by [BuySellAds](https://techcrunch.com/2018/04/25/buysellads-acquires-digg/) in 2018.
- Rose and Ohanian aim to revive Digg with a focus on community and user experience, aided by AI to reduce moderator workload.
- New CEO [Justin Mezzell](https://www.linkedin.com/in/justin-mezzell/) appointed; a launch for an updated platform is planned soon, with invites coming in the next few weeks.

items.title: ARM to sign $250M chip deal with Malaysia
items.author: Kate Park
items.summary:
- ARM Holdings signs a $250 million deal with the Malaysian government to enhance chip design in the country over 10 years.
- Malaysia will acquire seven of ARM's chip design blueprints and train 10,000 engineers on ARM technology.
- This partnership is part of Malaysia's strategy to establish itself as a global hub for chip manufacturing, backed by significant financial investment and infrastructure development efforts.

items.title: Apple is challenging U.K.’s iCloud encryption backdoor order
items.summary:
- Apple is contesting a U.K. Government data access order in the Investigatory Powers Tribunal (IPT).
- The order demands access to iCloud backups with end-to-end encryption, which Apple refused to create a backdoor for.
- Apple announced it would end access to encrypted iCloud storage for U.K. users as part of its response.
- The British Government claims Apple is not complying, despite continuing to offer the encrypted service in other regions.
- This case could set a precedent for the U.K.'s encryption-breaking powers, although the proceedings may be secret.

items.title: Darwinbox, the HR upstart from India, raises $140M to take on Deel and Rippling
items.summary:
- Darwinbox, an Indian SaaS platform for HR, raised $140 million to expand internationally, particularly in the U.S.
- Funding co-led by KKR and Partners Group, totaling approximately $270 million raised to date, with an estimated valuation of $950 million.
- Darwinbox serves over 1,000 enterprise customers and claims tools are used by more than 3 million people, with 60% of revenue from outside India.

items.title: From high school science project to $18.3M: AI-accelerated enzymes are coming for fast fashion’s plastic waste
items.summary:
- U.K. startup, Epoch Biodesign, raised $18.3 million in oversubscribed Series A funding to accelerate production of plastic-eating enzymes.
- Founded in 2019, the company is moving to its first production facility, aiming to process 150 tonnes of plastic waste per year.
- Enzymes developed target nylon and polyester, addressing a growing global plastic waste problem exacerbated by insufficient recycling efforts.
- Epoch uses generative AI to enhance enzyme design, leading to significant speed improvements and cost reductions in the recycling process.
- Strategic investment from Inditex, owner of Zara, emphasizes collaboration for sustainability in the fashion industry.

items.title: CoreWeave acquires AI developer platform Weights & Biases
items.author: Lukas Biewald, Chris Van Pelt, Shawn Lewis
items.summary:
- CoreWeave has acquired AI developer platform [Weights & Biases](https://techcrunch.com/2023/08/09/weights-biases-who-counts-openai-as-a-customer-lands-50m/) for an undisclosed amount.
- The acquisition cost is reported to be **$1.7 billion** according to [The Information](https://www.theinformation.com/articles/coreweave-in-talks-to-buy-ai-startup-weights-biases-for-around-1-7-billion).
- Weights & Biases was valued at **$1.25 billion** in 2023 and had recently filed for an IPO.
- Founded in 2017, Weights & Biases provides tools for developing AI applications used by over **1,400 organizations** including AstraZeneca and Nvidia.
- The acquisition will allow CoreWeave to offer enhanced cloud services and infrastructure for AI development workflows.

items.title: CoreWeave partner EcoDataCenter racks up half a billion dollars to build more sustainable buildings for AI
items.author: Ingrid Lunden
items.summary:
- EcoDataCenter raised $478 million in funding to develop eco-friendly data centers for AI demand.
- Funding will support new technologies for greener data centers and construction of facilities.
- The company has raised a total of €910 million ($966 million) in equity; no IPO plans currently.
- EDC focuses on sustainable colocation spaces and uses renewable energy in its operations.
- EDC's significant customer base includes major clients like CoreWeave and others in various industries.
- The fundraising reflects the increasing demand for data centers amid a global AI boom.

items.title: Meta brings its anti-fraud facial recognition test to the UK after getting a thumbs up from regulators
items.author: Ingrid Lunden
items.summary:
- Meta expands its facial recognition test to the UK, which includes tools to prevent scams and help users recover compromised accounts.
- The company received approval from UK regulators after discussions about AI technology.
- In-app notifications will inform public figures in the UK about opting in to receive facial recognition-enabled protection against celebrity bait scams.
- Meta assures that any facial data generated will be deleted after one-time use for comparison.
- The rollout comes amidst a broader push for AI integration in Meta's services, while the company faces scrutiny over past facial recognition practices and lawsuits.

items.title: Defense tech startup Epirus raises $250M Series D to counter drone swarms
items.author: Charles Rollet
items.summary:
- Epirus raises an oversubscribed $250 million in Series D funding for anti-drone systems.
- Previous valuation was $1.35 billion during the Series C in 2022, with the current valuation confirmed to be over $1 billion.
- Major investors include 8VC, Washington Harbour Partners, Gaingels, and General Dynamics Land Systems.
- The funding will be used to expand internationally, improve supply chain resiliency, and establish a new simulation center in Oklahoma.
- Epirus' flagship product, Leonidas, uses high-powered electromagnetic pulses against drones and is a popular choice among U.S. military contracts, including a $66 million deal in 2023.

items.title: Quantexa nabs $175M at a $2.6B valuation to double down on data analytics for AI
items.author: Ingrid Lunden
items.summary:
- Quantexa raises $175 million in Series F funding, valuing the company at $2.6 billion.
- The funding helps expand data analytics for AI and improve anti-money laundering efforts.
- Major clients include Prudential, Vodafone, HSBC, and the U.K. government.
- License revenue up 40% year over year, now has 800 employees across 16 global offices.
- Plans to strengthen partnerships with Microsoft and Databricks to enhance AI capabilities.

items.title: Key ex-OpenAI researcher subpoenaed in AI copyright case
items.author: Kyle Wiggers
items.summary:
- Alec Radford, ex-OpenAI researcher, subpoenaed in a copyright case against OpenAI on February 25.
- Plaintiffs include authors Paul Tremblay, Sarah Silverman, and Michael Chabon, alleging copyright infringement related to OpenAI's AI models.
- OpenAI claims its use falls under fair use; previous claims against OpenAI were dismissed, but the direct infringement claim continues.

items.title: Judge rejects Musk’s attempt to block OpenAI’s for-profit transition
items.summary:
- A federal judge denied Elon Musk's motion for an injunction against OpenAI's transition to a for-profit company.
- U.S. District Court Judge Yvonne Gonzalez Rogers noted Musk did not provide sufficient evidence for the injunction.
- The court is willing to hold an expedited trial based on claims that OpenAI's conversion is unlawful.
- Musk's lawsuit claims OpenAI abandoned its original nonprofit mission.
- Recently, Musk made a $97.4 billion unsolicited bid to purchase OpenAI, which was rejected by OpenAI's board.

items.title: Aspiration co-founder and board member defrauded investors of $145M, prosecutors say
items.author: Tim De Chant
items.summary:
- Aspiration co-founder Joseph Sanberg arrested for allegedly conspiring to defraud two funds of $145 million.
- Ibrahim AlHusseini, a former board member, pleaded guilty to wire fraud for falsifying documents to aid Sanberg.
- If convicted, both face up to 20 years in prison.
- The fintech startup had federal scrutiny for questionable financial practices prior to the criminal complaints.
- Sanberg secured loans using fraudulent tactics, including fake documents inflating assets.
- AlHusseini received $12.3 million from the scheme for guaranteeing repayment.
- The loans included a $55 million loan in 2020 and a $145 million loan in 2021. Sanberg defaulted on both loans, causing significant investor losses.

items.title: Amazon reportedly forms a new agentic AI group
items.summary:
[Amazon has formed a new group within AWS dedicated to creating AI agents.]
[AWS CEO Matt Garman stated that agentic AI could become a multi-billion dollar business for AWS.]
[Swami Sivasubramanian, a former AI and data team leader, will head the new group.]
[Recent developments showed Alexa+ with agentic capabilities like booking Ubers and navigating websites.]
[Amazon's AWS unit may develop enterprise agents to compete with Salesforce and Microsoft.]

items.title: X updates Communities with new filters, sorting options, and a way to see your own posts
items.author: Sarah Perez
items.summary:
- X enhances Communities feature allowing users to engage in discussions akin to Reddit.
- New sorting options include filtering posts by Trending, New, or Popular, and a specific timeframe: day, week, month, year, or all-time.
- Update is currently available on the iOS app, with plans for future releases on web and Android.

items.title: African VC LoftyInc Capital launches third fund for seed and Series A, reaches $43M first close
items.summary:
- LoftyInc Capital reaches first close of its third fund, LoftyInc Alpha, at $43 million.
- Fund targets late-seed and Series A startups across Nigeria, Egypt, Kenya, and Francophone Africa.
- Includes a diverse group of limited partners, such as sovereign wealth funds and development finance institutions.
- Aims to bridge the funding gap from pre-seed to Series A in Africa's startup ecosystem.
- LoftyInc has a history of backing notable startups and aims to leverage operational expertise for its portfolio.

items.title: Andy Dunn’s new app Pie uses AI to help you make friends
items.author: Amanda Silberling
items.summary:
- Andy Dunn, founder of Bonobos, launches a social app called Pie to help people make friends in real life.
- Pie raised $11.5 million in Series A funding and has over 130,000 monthly active users, available in San Francisco and Chicago.
- The app features an AI-powered quiz called Sparked Connections, grouping event attendees based on compatibility before social events.

items.title: Foundation Capital Raises $600M Fund, Focuses on Early Stage Investing
items.author: Marina Temkin
items.summary:
- Foundation Capital raised a $600 million eleventh flagship fund, 20% larger than its previous fund.
- The firm remains focused on seed stage investing, being the first institutional investor in over 70% of its portfolio companies.
- Notable past investments include early backing of Cerebras and Solana, with Cerebras currently valued at $4.25 billion.

items.title: Klarna CEO doubts that other companies will replace Salesforce with AI
items.author: Sebastian Siemiatkowski
items.summary:
- Klarna's CEO explains why the company switched from Salesforce to its own AI system over a year ago.
- He does not believe that other companies will follow Klarna's lead, suggesting that Salesforce is not at risk of going away.
- Klarna's in-house AI system, developed using OpenAI's ChatGPT, replaced 700 contract employees and saved approximately $40 million annually.
- Salesforce's CEO questioned Klarna's customer data management and compliance after the announcement.
- Siemiatkowski clarifies that Klarna consolidated data onto its own tech stack from various SaaS providers, not simply uploading data to OpenAI.

items.title: Amazon is reportedly developing its own AI ‘reasoning’ model
items.summary:
- Amazon is developing an AI model incorporating advanced reasoning capabilities.
- The model is expected to launch in June under Amazon’s Nova brand.
- Reasoning models provide step-by-step answers, improving reliability in math and science fields.
- Amazon intends to adopt a hybrid reasoning architecture for the model to deliver both quick answers and extended reasoning.
- The company aims to make the Nova model more price-efficient than competitors, which may be challenging.

items.title: Google still limits how Gemini answers political questions
items.author: Maxwell Zeff
items.summary:
- Google’s AI chatbot, Gemini, often states it “can’t help with responses on elections and political figures right now.”
- Competitors like OpenAI, Anthropic, and Meta AI engage more freely on political topics.
- Google initially announced restrictions in March 2024 before various elections and has not updated its stance since.
- Gemini has struggled to provide accurate political information, even failing to identify the current U.S. president and vice president at times.
- Critics claim Google is engaging in AI censorship by limiting responses to sensitive political discussions. 
- Other AI companies, including OpenAI, advocate for more open discourse on controversial topics.

items.title: Hackers launder most of Bybit’s stolen crypto worth $1.4B
items.author: Lorenzo Franceschi-Bicchierai
items.summary:
- Hackers stole approximately $1.4 billion in cryptocurrency from Bybit, making it the largest crypto theft in history.
- The attack occurred on February 21, resulting in the loss of 401,346 Ethereum, which was later mostly converted to Bitcoin.
- North Korean government is suspected to be behind the hack, according to blockchain monitoring firms and the FBI.

items.title: OpenAI chairman Bret Taylor lays out the bull case for AI agents
items.summary:
- Bret Taylor, OpenAI board chair, shared insights on AI agents at Mobile World Congress in Barcelona.
- He highlighted the evolution of AI customer service agents, emphasizing their multilingual capabilities and instant response times.
- Taylor anticipates AI agents will become as significant for companies as websites or mobile apps within the next decade.
- Significant concerns include the necessity of implementing guard rails to prevent potential issues with AI accuracy and customer support.
- He stressed the importance of public-private partnerships to reskill the workforce affected by AI-driven job changes.
- Taylor reassured that OpenAI's mission to develop beneficial general AI will remain unchanged despite potential structural adjustments.

items.title: TechCrunch Sessions: AI speaker applications close March 7, submit yours today
items.summary:
- TechCrunch Sessions: AI event is on June 5, 2025, at Zellerbach Hall, UC Berkeley.  
- Applications for speakers close March 7, 2025, at midnight.  
- Speakers can lead 50-minute sessions including presentations and discussions for AI topics.  
- Selected speakers gain access to exclusive networking and promotional opportunities.  
- Topics can include startups, AI tools, infrastructure, and innovative ideas.

items.title: Google’s March Pixel Drop has AI-powered scam detection and live location sharing with friends
items.author: Ivan Mehta
items.summary:
- Google announced March software updates for Pixel phones, including AI scam detection in calls and messages.
- The update also introduces live location sharing via the Find My Devices app and menstrual tracking on Pixel Watch 3.
- Beta testing concluded, favoring Gemini Nano for scam detection on Pixel 9 series in the U.S.
- Additional features: new screenshot app updates, external camera support for streaming, and image generation in Pixel Studio app.
- Expansion of satellite messaging support for Verizon and T-Mobile users, now including Canada and EMEA regions.
- New Gemini features include multimodal capabilities and support for over 45 languages for conversations.
- Android updates focus on scam detection and live tracking features for Android users, plus shopping insights in Chrome.

items.title: Automattic CEO Matt Mullenweg talks succession — ‘I don’t want to pass it to a committee’
items.author: Sarah Perez
items.summary:
- Matt Mullenweg, CEO of Automattic, faces calls to step down amid controversy with WP Engine.
- Plans to ensure succession without passing leadership to a committee; aims to find a suitable successor.
- Discussed the importance of retaining majority control for future leadership in a podcast.
- Emphasized the community's role and accountability in stewardship of WordPress.
- Recognized that Automattic’s efforts have introduced over 100 million users to WordPress software.

items.title: Cohere claims its new Aya Vision AI model is best-in-class
items.author: Kyle Wiggers
items.summary:
- Cohere released Aya Vision, a multimodal AI model claimed to be best-in-class for tasks like image captioning, Q&A, translation, and summarization in 23 languages.
- The model is available for free via WhatsApp and aims to bridge performance gaps in AI across languages.
- Aya Vision comes in two versions, 32B and 8B, with 32B outperforming larger models on certain benchmarks.
- Both models are accessible via Hugging Face under a Creative Commons license, but not for commercial use.
- Synthetic annotations were used in training to enhance efficiency and support for the research community.
- Cohere also introduced AyaVisionBench for evaluating vision-language tasks and addressing concerns in AI benchmarking.

items.title: Solar installer Sunnova races to raise cash as it issues ‘going concern’ warning
items.author: Tim De Chant
items.summary:
- Sunnova issued a 'going concern' warning due to cash shortages.
- The company’s stock is down approximately 68%, raising bankruptcy concerns.
- Sunnova plans to refinance debt, raise new debt, and cut expenses to avoid insolvency.
- The company reported a net loss of $447 million in 2024, down from previous losses, and its market cap has plummeted to around $63 million from a previous valuation of $4.5 billion.
- High interest rates and uncertainty about the Inflation Reduction Act are contributing to the instability of the solar industry.
- Sunrun, the largest U.S. installer, recently lowered cash generation guidance, indicating a challenging outlook for installations.
- Despite challenges, First Solar reportedly exceeded earnings expectations, highlighting some positive aspects in the industry.

items.title: Didi reportedly seeking funds for self-driving unit at $5B valuation
items.summary:
- Didi is seeking new funding for its autonomous vehicle unit, potentially valuing it at $5 billion.
- High investor interest in self-driving technology is noted, influenced by recent IPOs from WeRide and Pony AI.
- Didi's self-driving unit has raised $1.55 billion to date and is in discussions to raise more funds.
- Currently testing around 200 autonomous vehicles in major Chinese cities but has not yet launched commercial operations.
- Funds may aid in further development of AV technology and mass production of electric robotaxis, expected to begin in 2025.

items.title: On a quest to revive the woolly mammoth, Colossal Biosciences has created a woolly mouse
items.author: Marina Temkin
items.summary:
[Colossal Biosciences aims to resurrect the woolly mammoth by 2028](https://techcrunch.com/2025/03/04/on-a-quest-to-revive-the-woolly-mammoth-colossal-biosciences-has-created-a-woolly-mouse/) and has made progress by creating a genetically engineered woolly mouse.
[Scientists used CRISPR](https://techcrunch.com/2025/03/04/on-a-quest-to-revive-the-woolly-mammoth-colossal-biosciences-has-created-a-woolly-mouse/) to edit mouse embryos to exhibit mammoth-like fur traits, adapting them to survive in cold climates.
Approval from the [Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC)](https://olaw.nih.gov/resources/tutorial/iacuc.htm) is required before further experiments on these engineered mice can occur.
